SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

teams.ucmTeam
Class RobotAPI

java.lang.Object
  teams.ucmTeam.RobotAPI

public final class RobotAPI
extends java.lang.Object

This is the robot's interface with the world. This class includes the sensor and actuator methods that a robot can execute.

The field is 152.5cm by 274cm. Each goal is 50cm wide. The *goalkeeper area*, centered on the goal, is 100cm wide by 22.5cm deep. In the coordinate system used in the simulation, the *center of the field* is (0,0) with +x to the right (east) and +y up (north). The team that starts on the left side (or *west field*) is called the *west team* and the team on the right (or *east field*) is called the *east team*. The following schema sketches the main points for the west field (coordinates are in meters). 

       (-1.37, 0.7625)     --------------------------------------------------
                          |                        |                         |
                          |                        |                         |
          (-1.37, 0.5)    ------ (-1.145, 0.5)     |                     -----
                          |    |                   |                     |   |
         (-1.37, 0.25)    #    |                   |                     |   #
                          #    |                   * (0,0)               |   #
        (-1.37, -0.25)    #    |                   |                     |   #
                          |    |                   |                     |   |
         (-1.37, -0.5)    ------ (-1.145, -0.5)    |                     -----
                          |                        |                         |
                          |                        |                         |
       (-1.37, -0.7625)    --------------------------------------------------

public int getPlayerNumber()
Get the robot's player number, between 0 and the number of robots in the team. Don't confuse this with getID, which returns a unique number for the object in the simulation as a whole, not in its individual team.

setSpeed

public void setSpeed(double speed)
Set the desired speed for the robot (translation). The speed must be between 0 and 1; where 0 is stopped and 1.0 is "full blast". It will be clipped to whichever limit it exceeds.

Parameters:
speed - the desired speed from 0 to 1.0.

setSteerHeading

Parameters:

setDisplayString

public void setDisplayString(java.lang.String s)
Set the String that is printed on the robot's display. For real robots, this is printed on the console. For simulated robots, this appears printed below the agent when view "Robot State" is selected.

Parameters:
s - String, the text to display.

                                                EDU.gatech.cc.is.util.Vec2 destination)
Moves behind a given point, pushes that point trying to reach another destination point.

Parameters:
pushingPoint - Point where player goes behind. This vector is egocentric from the player position.
destination - Point where player should push to. This vector's origin is the pushingPoint.
Returns:
Vector with the direction to go behind the ball

public static java.io.File createFile(java.lang.Class<?> classRequester,
                                      java.lang.String filename)
Gets a file in a unique folder according to the class that requests the file. If the file does not exist, then it is created.

Parameters:
classRequester - The class that requests the file. It is used to obtain the folder name
filename - the name of the file to create or open
Returns:
The file handler of the requested file. If the file handler cannot be created it returns a null reference
